meanings.definition: Having an extra syllable at the end of a line of verse.
meanings.sent1: The hypercatalectic poem sounded unique with its extra syllable.
meanings.sent2: Her hypercatalectic writing style added a twist to traditional poetry.
meanings.sent3: The hypercatalectic verse made the audience chuckle at its unexpected length.
meanings.sent4: The hypercatalectic rhythm danced playfully through the lines of the poem.
meanings.sent5: The hypercatalectic ending of the sonnet lingered in the reader's mind.

meanings.definition: A line of verse with an extra syllable at the end.
meanings.sent1: In the poetry book, there was a hypercatalectic that stood out.
meanings.sent2: The hypercatalectic in the sonnet disrupted the flow of the poem.
meanings.sent3: At the poetry slam, the hypercatalectic drew unexpected laughs from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The hypercatalectic in the ballad was like a surprise twist at the end of a story.
meanings.sent5: The hypercatalectic in the haiku added an interesting challenge for the poet.
